item.title: A correction of address regarding garden complaints., 26th August
item.description:
I would like to make a correction regarding recent complaints made about the state of the garden in Manor Way. The address stated in the reports is incorrect and is that of an upstairs maisonette above number 36 as you can see in the map attached. The garden that the complaints are being made about belongs to 108 Magpie Hall Lane. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light out making it very dark., 26th August
item.description:
Street light is out . My daughter works late and is afraid to walk past this part on her own. This is the second time I’ve reported this issue , first time being 3 months ago ! It has the number 36 on the side of that helps with locating it . Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Piccadilly, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 1-14 Thetford House - Lift H&S issue - needs urgent cleaning, 26th August
item.description:
There has been dog or human waste left in the lift for at least three days, which poses a serious health and safety issue that requires urgent attention. This situation is particularly concerning for residents with disabilities who are trapped and unable to use the lift. The council and the police only monitor the building during office hours, when these incidents are less likely to occur. There is no nighttime patrol or CCTV monitoring to address the ongoing issues! We are constantly facing problems with drug users frequenting our estate, using the communal areas as a restroom, a bar, or a place to sleep, which has made all residents and tenants fearful to come and go from their properties. When will we finally be equipped with the long-awaited safety entrance intercom system and/or CCTV? Moreover, the communal lift landings have not been cleaned in almost a year, which makes me question why I am paying service charges. I will be filing an official complaint with the tribunal, as this situation has persisted for far too long without any action taken, despite multiple reports.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 26th August
item.description:
Inside Scadbury Park Nature Reserve, Chislehurst via Perry Street public car park heading towards St Paul’s Green in St Paul’s Cray: There are white sheets which have been dumped - please see the attached picture. You recently closed my previous report on here stating that you couldn’t locate them however they are very much still there and are easy to spot. Please could you remove them.

item.title: Homeless and drug issue in Goulton Road, 25th August
item.description:
Residents have reported feeling unsafe, particularly during evening hours, as the presence of drug activity often attracts antisocial behaviour. The issue also poses health and hygiene risks, with discarded drug paraphernalia sometimes left in public areas
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goulton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear local Trowbridge Residence and leaseholders please be advised and beware of organised gang criminal group that are stealing motor vehicles on a daily basis at this location and operating from Beanacre Cl, London E9 5JY,Merriam Ave, London E9 5LS has been reported to the local Hackney council anti-social behavior department and the metropolitan police service which seem to be lazy to act or do anything about this anti-social behavior and criminal activity. Criminal gang have recently stolen a white Toyota from Brentwood, also stole a gray Audi from Richmond Kew gardens, they have nicked cars from Ilford and Romford, stealing car Kent, they are stealing all different types of cars but they seem to have a thing for Toyota's Criminals are stealing motor vehicles and robbery on a daily basis in all different boroughs. once they have stolen the vehicle. they then drive the stolen car back to the location at Beanacre Cl, London E9 5JY,Merriam Ave, London E9 5LS to strip the vehicle down and change the identity of the stolen car i.e clone plates switch to avoid police capture an ampr cameras, throwing number plates down Hackney council manhole cover drainage system,removing GPS trackers, previous owners property and possessions are then discarded in and around public footpath on the floor,on roofs,in gardens, down drain covers, criminal gang discard anything that can link them to the robbery or crime by discarding evidence. Criminal activity takes place all hours,early hours daytime,morning.Organise gang also using mopeds to do the robberies and cars. The gang are wearing dark clothing tracksuits with face masks and gloves. The gang possibly are Irish travellers. By the sounds of it the local council do not care about stolen vehicles and anti-social behavior also the metropolitan police show an incompetence attitude towards the reports that are being made in regards to stolen vehicles and robbery allowing this to happen. Residence and leaseholders have to remember at the end of the day Hackney council and the police get a wage and they go home they don't care. Safer neighbourhood police have allowed this to go on for many years.SNT Not using their initiative and being lazy to investigate. Hackney council and the metropolitan police safe and neighborhood team need to work alongside with Hackney council to come up with a strategic plan to tackle these issues. Assigning a DS officer to investigate.who has experienced in organised crime not like snt and surveillance operations., 25th August
item.description:
